intro: Osteospermum dregei var. reticulatum, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and blue or purple petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, gray-green leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements. Its blooms are short-lived but abundant, often appearing in clusters throughout the growing season.
